gameCore

Class Exit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • gameCore.LayoutObject
        • gameCore.Edge
          • gameCore.Exit

  • public class Exit
extends Edge
    An exit is an Edge with a "lock." When locked, it is crossable only by a character with the specified key.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Group D, Main Author: Darrell Penner Group D Members --------------- Karen Madore Trang Pham Darrell Penner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Exit(Tile tile1, Tile tile2, boolean locked, Direction direction1, Direction direction2, Item key)
      Creates the edge, and sets the edge for the two tiles in the given directions.
      Exit(Tile tile1, Tile tile2, boolean locked, Item key)
      Constructs an exit

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Gets the name of the key required to unlock the exit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Exit

        public Exit(Tile tile1,
    Tile tile2,
    boolean locked,
    Item key)
        Constructs an exit
        Parameters:
        tile1 - One side of the edge
        tile2 - The other side of the edge
        locked - Whether the door is locked or not
        key - The key that unlocks the door (can be null if door starts unlocked)

      • Exit

        public Exit(Tile tile1,
    Tile tile2,
    boolean locked,
    Direction direction1,
    Direction direction2,
    Item key)
        Creates the edge, and sets the edge for the two tiles in the given directions. If the edge is between a tile and the boundary of a level, the extra tile is to be null.
        Parameters:
        tile1 - One side of the edge
        tile2 - The other side of the edge
        direction1 - The direction of the edge relative to tile1
        direction2 - The direction of the edge relative to tile2

    • Method Detail

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Checks if the exit is locked
        Returns:
        True if the exit is unlocked, false otherwise

      • canCross

        public boolean canCross(Character crosser)
        Checks whether the Exit is unlocked or locked and the character has the key
        Overrides:
        canCross in class Edge
        Returns:
        True if it is possible to cross from one tile to the next, false otherwise

      • cross

        public Tile cross(Tile currentTile,
         Character crosser)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Places a Character on the Tile on the other side of the Edge
        Overrides:
        cross in class Edge
        Parameters:
        currentTile - The current tile the Character resides on
        crosser - The Character crossing the edge
        Returns:
        The Character's new tile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - crosser was either null or did not have a key. Use canCross(Character) first.

      • unlock

        public boolean unlock(Item key)
        Unlocks the exit
        Parameters:
        key - The key to attempt the unlock with
        Returns:
        True if unlocking succeeded, false otherwise

      • getKeyName

        public java.lang.String getKeyName()
        Gets the name of the key required to unlock the exit. Can't return the key itself, otherwise, that gives a way to easily unlock the exit!
        Returns:
        name of the key
